data.title: Apply to Rockford University
data.meta_description: Apply to Rockford University Rockford University
data.text:
Test-Optional Admissions: Worried about those SAT or ACT scores? Don’t be! We’re test-optional, which means you can choose whether or not to submit those scores. It’s all about giving you flexibility in the application process. Two Easy Ways to Apply: We’ve got options for you when it comes to submitting your application. Pick the one that suits you best:

1. Online Application for all students.

2. Common App (for undergraduates).

Join us at Rockford University, where your journey to academic excellence begins. Apply now, and let’s get this adventure started!

Choose your program

First-Year Undergraduate:

Request that your high school sends us your official high school transcripts.

Submit your FAFSA (Free Application for Federal Student Aid) Form. To obtain a form, go to studentaid.gov to file electronically. The FAFSA code for Rockford University is 001748.

More info about Financial Aid

Submit your deposit!

Transfer Undergraduate

Request that all colleges and universities you have attended send us your official transcripts.

If you have less than 12 hours of college or university credit, please also send us your official high school transcripts. Apply!

Graduate:

The Online Bachelor’s Degree Completion program at Rockford University offers three major options: business management, accounting, or human services. The flexible online format enables working professionals, parents, military service members, frequent travelers and many more to earn a Rockford University degree. Apply!

International:

If you are an international student, you can submit an application to any of the above programs. If you have additional questions or require assistance, reach out to our friendly Admissions team at admissions@rockfordu.edu or give us a ring at (815) 226-4138.
